news.title: SpaceX's Starship explodes during routine test in Texas
news.summary: Starship "suffered a catastrophic failure and exploded," local authorities said. No injuries were reported at the time. An investigation into the incident is underway.

news.title: How retail credit cards could bankrupt consumers with record high interest rates
news.summary: Retail credit card debt is accounting for a greater proportion of overall debt in consumer bankruptcies. Retail credit card debts account for more than half of all consumer debt.

news.title: A 'terrible spiral of escalation': World braces for intensifying Iran-Israel conflict
news.summary: Iran and Israel continue to trade deadly blows. Chances at diplomacy are looking bleak as Iran and Israel trade increasingly deadly blows, says CNN's John Sutter.

news.title: M&A market 'back to global financial crisis levels,' UN trade arm warns in downbeat economic outlook
news.summary: UN's trade agency, UNCTAD, sums up the global economic outlook in an annual report. Report: Higher risk, lower growth, and declining investment.

news.title: Google looks likely to lose appeal against record $4.7 billion EU fine
news.summary: The fine relates to a long-running antitrust case surrounding Google's Android operating system. The fine relating to the long- running antitrust case is $2.05 billion.

news.title: Block out the noise and stay invested: Stock picks and advice from one of the world’s oldest mutual funds.
news.summary: The Investment Company of America fund has rolled with World Wars and evolving economies. These are its stock picks. Since launching in 1934, the fund has made a profit every year.

news.title: ‘Everybody is in danger’ as budget cuts gut caregiving services
news.summary: Ai-jen Poo is featured in Bradley Cooper’s PBS “Caregiving” documentary. Poo: “The story of caregiving in America is everyone’S story.”

news.title: Is the stock market open today for Juneteenth? Will the post office deliver mail?
news.summary: Juneteenth is the newest federal holiday in the U.S. It marks the end of slavery in the United States. Here's what is closed on Juneteenth, June 19.

news.title: Zero rate policy is back after Swiss cut, while Bank of England pauses after four cuts this year
news.summary: The Swiss National Bank lowered interest rates to zero on Thursday. The move is the latest in a string of interest rate cuts in recent years.

news.title: Global stocks fall, oil futures rise, on a report U.S. may soon strike Iran
news.summary: Asian and European stocks fell on Thursday, and oil futures rose. Reports suggest a U.S. military strike against Iran could happen this weekend.
